The payoff matrix above shows the profits of two firms, Alpha and Beta, that compete against each other. Each firm must decide to set a high or low price. The first numeric entry shows Alpha’s profits; the second entry shows Beta’s profits. Each firm is aware of the information in this payoff matrix.
content.question: Given that each firm is aware of the information in the payoff matrix, which of the following is true?

choices.label: Neither Alpha nor Beta has a dominant strategy.
Both Alpha and Beta have a dominant strategy to price high.
Both Alpha and Beta have a dominant strategy to price low.
Alpha has a dominant strategy to price low, whereas Beta has a dominant strategy to price high.
Alpha has a dominant strategy to price high, whereas Beta has no dominant strategy.

content.answer: Both Alpha and Beta have a dominant strategy to price low.
